NAME: Priyank Jain
ABOUT:
Priyank currently works as an analyst with Goldman Sachs in Corporate Treasury department. 

He pursued MBA from Indian Institute of Foreign Trade, Delhi where he undertook summer internship at Goldman Sachs and received a pre-placement offer. He represented India in prestigious CFA Research Challenge at Asia-pacific level in Sydney, Australia in 2019. In 2020, OP Jindal Group recognized him as one of the Top-20 management scholars in the country and awarded him the OPJEMS scholarship. He is a finance enthusiast and held the position of Senior Coordinator of Capital - The Finance and Investment Club, IIFT. 

He completed his undergraduate studies from Jaypee Institute of Information Technology, Noida and had an offer from Deloitte. He worked with Deloitte India Risk Advisory Team for 6 months before joining IIFT. He maintained an impactful academic record throughout and was part of several state and college level student bodies as well.

He has struck a healthy balance between his academics and co-curriculars by involving himself in debates, conclaves, idea presentations and has won laurels at even international level. He has a keen interest in swimming and has also won zonal and district level championships.

He has a blend of technical and innovative mindset and was a core team member of Entrepreneurship Cell promoted by DST, Govt. of India.

EDUCATION.Institute Name: SRMPS - Shri Ramswaroop Memorial Public School

EXPERIENCE.Designation: The Times of India - Student News Correspondent
Senior Coordinator, Capital - The Finance and Investments Club

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Authorship Attribution using Machine Learning to de-anonymize Quora answers
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: To identify various nuances of the writing style of an author | classification using multi-classifiers and comparing their accuracies | Graphical comparison of two authors | Using the information to de-anonymize answers on Quora.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Real time based Women Security (Android & Web) with Mobile Theft Detection tool
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Features: 1. Emergency and Accident Panic button | 2. Automatic messaging and mailing through the app | 3. Real-time based tracking using Google Maps API and sending notification to people nearby | 4. Police control room, Ambulance services, State women helpline number | 5. Intelligent Mobile theft detection tool

This software calculates stability percentage between two partners based on Artificial Intelligence Approach to make stable roommate pairs in hostels. It then generates a Hostel Room Map based upon  optimal matching.

HONOR & AWARD.Title: CFA Institute Research Challenge | India Winner
